title.original: New REST API v2: Performance and authentication improvements

author: Maria Lopez
content: We have launched version 2 of our REST API with significant improvements. The new API includes enhanced OAuth2 authentication, cursor-based pagination support, and a new endpoint for batch queries. Response times have improved by 40% thanks to index and cache optimization. This update is backward compatible with v1 for 6 months.

title.original: Advertencia de seguridad: Vulnerabilidad en el sistema de autenticación

author: Equipo de Seguridad
content: Hemos identificado una vulnerabilidad crítica en el sistema de autenticación que podría permitir acceso no autorizado. La vulnerabilidad afecta a usuarios que utilizan tokens JWT emitidos antes del 15 de octubre. Recomendamos actualizar inmediatamente a la versión 3.2.1 del SDK. Todos los tokens afectados han sido revocados automáticamente. Por favor, regenere sus credenciales de acceso.

title.original: New visualization dashboard: Interactive charts and real-time analytics

author: Ana Ruiz
content: We present our new visualization dashboard with advanced capabilities. It includes interactive line charts, bar charts, and heat maps. Users can create custom visualizations by dragging and dropping fields. The system now supports real-time analytics with updates every 5 seconds. We have also added PDF and PNG export for reports.

title.original: Important changes to the notification system

author: Carlos Rivera
content: We have made important changes to the notification system. We now support push, email, and SMS notifications. Users can configure custom rules to receive alerts based on metric thresholds. The new system includes a notification history and the ability to temporarily mute certain types of alerts. These changes require a mobile client update.

title.original: Riesgos conocidos al migrar de la versión 1.x a 2.0
title.translated_title: Known Risks When Migrating from Version 1.x to 2.0

author: Laura Pérez
content: Si estás planeando migrar de la versión 1.x a 2.0, hay varios riesgos importantes a considerar. El cambio más significativo es la nueva estructura de datos que requiere transformación de esquemas. Algunos endpoints han sido deprecados y otros tienen cambios en los parámetros requeridos. Recomendamos hacer la migración primero en un ambiente de staging y validar todas las integraciones. Hemos creado una guía detallada de migración.

title.original: Complete guide to the new API: Endpoints and examples

author: Tomas Hernandez
content: This guide describes in detail all endpoints of the new API v2. It includes code examples in Python, JavaScript, and cURL for each endpoint. We cover authentication, resource creation, queries, updates, and deletion. We also explain error handling, rate limiting, and best practices. Complete documentation is available on our developer portal.

title.original: Tutorial: Creating custom visualizations step by step

author: Daniel Vega
content: Learn how to create custom visualizations from scratch. This tutorial covers how to select the appropriate chart type, configure axes and scales, apply filters, and customize colors and styles. It includes practical examples for visualizing sales data, performance metrics, and trend analysis. We also explain how to share visualizations with your team.

title.original: Actualización crítica: Corrección de error en procesamiento de datos
title.translated_title: Critical Update: Data Processing Error Fix

author: Equipo de Desarrollo
content: Hemos corregido un error crítico que causaba pérdida de datos en ciertos escenarios de procesamiento. El error afectaba a usuarios que procesaban más de 10,000 registros simultáneamente. La corrección está disponible en la versión 2.1.3. Si has procesado grandes volúmenes de datos recientemente, por favor verifica la integridad de tus datos y contacta a soporte si encuentras discrepancias.

title.original: Best practices for using the new API efficiently

author: Lucia Martinez
content: We share best practices for using the new API efficiently. It includes caching techniques, using batch queries to reduce calls, implementing retry logic with exponential backoff, and how to optimize rate limit usage. We also cover recommended design patterns and how to structure your code to keep it maintainable and scalable.

title.original: Comparative analysis: Technical vs. introductory articles

author: Pedro Alvarez
content: We have analyzed the most popular articles in our community and found interesting patterns. Deep technical articles (with code and advanced examples) have higher long-term engagement, while introductory articles have more initial traffic. Technical articles are often more shared in developer communities, while introductory articles are better for SEO and new user acquisition.

title.original: New visualization features: Heat maps and scatter plots

author: Mike Chen
content: We have added two new types of visualizations: heat maps to identify patterns in multidimensional data, and scatter plots for correlation analysis. Heat maps are especially useful for analyzing temporal and geographic data. Scatter plots include interactive zoom and filtering tools. Both features are available in the Pro plan.

title.original: Advertencia: Cambios en el comportamiento de filtros de fecha
title.translated_title: Warning: Changes in Date Filter Behavior

author: Sarah Johnson
content: Hemos cambiado el comportamiento de los filtros de fecha para ser más consistentes con las zonas horarias. Los filtros ahora usan UTC por defecto en lugar de la zona horaria local del navegador. Esto puede afectar consultas que dependen de rangos de fechas específicos. Si notas resultados inesperados en tus consultas de fechas, por favor actualiza tus filtros para usar timestamps UTC explícitos.

title.original: Summary of articles about data visualizations

author: Alex Turner
content: This article summarizes all available resources about visualizations on our platform. It covers everything from basic tutorials to advanced customization guides. It includes references to articles about chart types, design best practices, performance optimization, and specific use cases. Ideal for users who want to learn about visualizations in a structured way.

title.original: Migration risk: Considerations for updating to the new architecture

author: Jessica Martinez
content: If you're considering updating to the new architecture, there are several risks to consider. The most important change is the database migration that requires planned downtime. There are also changes in the configuration structure that may break existing integrations. We recommend doing a complete impact assessment before proceeding. We have created a migration checklist available in our repository.

title.original: Complete API documentation: Reference and examples

author: Kevin Park
content: This complete documentation covers all aspects of the API. It includes reference for all endpoints with detailed descriptions, required and optional parameters, response codes, and request and response examples. It also includes authentication guides, error handling, rate limiting, and versioning. The documentation is available in interactive format with the ability to test endpoints directly from the browser.
